intro: Heracleum oreocharis, commonly known as the mountain cowparn, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Heracleum oreocharis is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
